Key Match Events: Jordan Poole scored 30 points to lead the Wizards to a 125-107 win over the Bulls
Kyshawn George buried a 3-pointer to stretch the Wizards’ lead to 16 points, 100-84, with 10:20 remaining
Washington led by as many as 12 points in the second quarter, but the Bulls closed the half on an 12-5 run to trim the Wizards’ advantage to four, 55-51, at halftime
Others: Jordan Poole made his return to the Wizards lineup after missing the two previous games with a hip injury
Justin Champagnie added 15 points, while Carlton Carrington scored 11 points and made all three of his 3-point attempts to help push Washington to its third win in seven games
Rookie Alexandre Sarr logged 11 points, 10 rebounds and a season-high-tying five assists
Chicago’s Zach LaVine led all scorers with 32 points on 12-of-20 shooting in the loss, while Coby White added 17 points and Nikola Vucevic contributed 12 points and 14 rebounds

Washington shot 49.5 percent (49 of 99) from the field, making 17 of 36 attempts from 3-point range (47.2 percent). Chicago made 41 of its 92 attempts from the field (44.6 percent) and shot 29.8 percent (14 of 47) from 3-point range
Chicago outrebounded Washington 44-42 but turned the ball over 20 times on the way to being outscored 33-11 in points off turnovers
